results.title: Delia Smith's summer collection
results.brief_description: The essence of summer is encapsulated into a sunny collection of recipes from Delia Smith, using the produce of the summer months. “Green leaves and gooseberries” shows fresh ways with herbs, salads and gooseberries. “All the world loves an icecream” introduces some unusual but delicious icecreams. “Summer fish and shellfish” shows new ways with prawns, trout, skate and crab. “A Holiday at home” demonstrates the foods of Greece, Italy and Spain and in “Food al fresco” Delia continues the holiday themes by cooking American and Eastern barbecue dishes as well as a traditional English afternoon tea. In the second volume of this series “Bright meals for sunny days” discusses curries and other spicy dishes, “A Fruitful summer” deals with fruits such as redcurrants, strawberries, peaches and raspberries, “A Vegetarian summer” deals with goat’s cheese, vegetables and home-made pizza and finally in “The Summer kitchen garden” we are shown how to preserve the tastes of summer in jams, pickles, pesto.

results.title: Delia
results.brief_description: Two friends at boarding school ponder over who would miss them if they died - with unexpected and horrifying results. Cast includes Natasha Riedel and Simon Dumbleton. (Awards: Winner, Best Independent Film, Best Actress, Queensland New Filmmakers Awards, 1999)

results.title: Delhi
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Delhi, yesterday and today. Seven times capital of India, it combines the architectural splendour of Mogul and earlier times with a modern garden city. The hotels; the new diplomatic enclave; the mosques and palaces of Shah Jehan; a pre-Mogul fort; holidaying in Delhi today.

results.title: Delegation
results.brief_description: Aims to provide all levels of management with skills and knowledge to be able to effectively delegate. The program looks at the definition and benefits of delegation, barriers to effective delegation, ascertaining which tasks can and cannot be delegated, setting goals and choosing the best person for the job. A manual accompanies the video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Delegating
results.brief_description: Examines the concept of delegating by means of scenarios, making viewers aware of some of the hidden traps in delegation, as well as providing basic steps for managers and teachers that can ease the workload.

results.title: Delegates
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart and Derek Hart Productions
results.brief_description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. The role of the delegates is clearly portrayed as they visit families to discover their needs and distribute aid, act as mediators in tricky and often dangerous situations and to generally bring about peace and reduce human suffering

results.title: Delayed parenthood: pros and cons
results.brief_description: Looks at the increasing number of women who are having children later in life because of career pressure. Risks such as birth defects are examined and women who have had children later in life are interviewed.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 6-10
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 6-10 include: Thou shalt not commit adultery (58 min.)— Thou shalt not steal (55 min.)—Thou shalt not bear false witness (54 min.)— Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife (58 min.)—Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s goods (57 min.). Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 1-5 include: I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other God but me (53 min.)—Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain (57 min.)—Honour the Sabbath Day (55 min.)— Honour thy father and mother (55 min.)—Thou shalt not kill (57 min.) Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 1-5 include: I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other God but me (53 min.)—Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain (57 min.)—Honour the Sabbath Day (55 min.)— Honour thy father and mother (55 min.)—Thou shalt not kill (57 min.) Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Degenocide: the second best of the original DGeneration
results.creator_credit: Joe Murray, Peter Ots, David Cameron, Ted Emery, Kris Noble, Mark Gibson, Michael Hirsch, Andrew Knight and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This video contains comedy sketches from the 1986 and 1987 ABC seasons of the D-Generation, the best of the 1988 Channel 7 specials inculding ‘Degenocide’, and the re-voicing of ‘Homicide’. Starring such comedy luminaries as Rob Sitch, Magda Szubanski, Santo Cilauro, Marg Downey and Michael Veitch and including such classics as: ‘Thunderbirds’, ‘The Kerrigan Brothers’, ‘The Irish Rovers’ and ‘Tommy Cravat Jnr’, ‘The Dubbo Olympics’ and a very poor snooker trick indeed!
